title: Craig Anton
text:
Craig Ward Anton (born August 28, 1962) is an American <a href="actor">actor</a> and <a href="comedian">comedian</a>. He is best known for his roles as Mr. Pettus in "<a href="Lizzie%20McGuire">Lizzie McGuire</a>" and Lloyd Diffy in "<a href="Phil%20of%20the%20Future">Phil of the Future</a>".
Early life.
Anton was born and raised in <a href="Omaha%2C%20Nebraska">Omaha, Nebraska</a>, the eldest son of Antoinette (Akromis) and Arthur Ward Anton. He has a younger brother, Brian, and two sisters, Toni and Megan. Anton graduated from <a href="Omaha%20Burke%20High%20School">Omaha Burke High School</a> in 1980, and the University of Nebraska at Lincoln in 1996.
Career.
Anton started acting as a kid in <a href="Omaha%2C%20Nebraska">Omaha, Nebraska</a> and made his career as a stand-up comedian at age 17, performing in comedy clubs in 1978 while in high school. He attended the <a href="University%20of%20Nebraska">University of Nebraska</a> and graduated in 1983 with a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts%20degree">B.A.</a> in <a href="Theater">Theater</a> and <a href="English%20studies">English</a>. Anton began his career as a college circuit comedian in the 1980s. In 1984, he traveled the <a href="Mediterranean">Mediterranean</a> and <a href="Middle%20East">Middle East</a> as part of an all-comedy <a href="USO%20tour">USO tour</a>, spending two months in <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a>, <a href="Bahrain">Bahrain</a>, <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, <a href="Israel">Israel</a> and <a href="Spain">Spain</a> entertaining troops. In 1985, he was named <a href="Showtime%20%28TV%20network%29">Showtime</a>'s Funniest Person in <a href="Nebraska">Nebraska</a>. In the late 1980s, Anton moved to <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a> and pursued some acting opportunities, then moved to <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>. He currently teaches at <a href="Savannah%20College%20of%20Art%20and%20Design">SCAD</a> in <a href="Savannah%2C%20Georgia">Savannah, Georgia</a>.
Awards and nominations.
Anton was nominated for the <a href="National%20Association%20for%20Campus%20Activities">National Association for Campus Activities</a> Campus Entertainer of the Year award three times.
2 Headed Dog.
He is a member of comedy group <a href="2%20Headed%20Dog">2 Headed Dog</a> with comedians <a href="Jim%20Turner%20%28comedian%29">Jim Turner</a>, <a href="Mark%20Fite">Mark Fite</a>, and <a href="Dave%20Allen%20%28actor%29">Dave (Gruber) Allen</a>.
"First Time Out" and "MADtv".
In the fall of 1995, Anton booked two TV pilots in <a href="Los%20Angeles">Los Angeles</a>. He was cast as Nathan in <a href="The%20WB">The WB</a> <a href="sitcom">sitcom</a> "<a href="First%20Time%20Out">First Time Out</a>" which premiered in September and was later cast on the <a href="Fox%20Broadcasting%20Company">FOX</a> <a href="sketch%20comedy">sketch comedy</a> <a href="Television%20program">series</a> "<a href="MADtv">MADtv</a>" in October. Anton's other show "<a href="First%20Time%20Out">First Time Out</a>" was quickly cancelled two months after the premiere of "<a href="MADtv">MADtv</a>". His most enduring character was <a href="Clorox">Clorox</a> from the "Star Trek: Deep Stain Nine" sketches. <a href="Clorox">Clorox</a> was supposed to be the main nemesis of the sketch and he was loosely based on <a href="Q%20%28Star%20Trek%29">Q</a> from "<a href="Star%20Trek">Star Trek</a>". He impersonated <a href="Dennis%20Miller">Dennis Miller</a> and <a href="Nate%20Richert">Nate Richert</a> before leaving the show in 1998 at the end of the third season.
Other television projects.
Since leaving "<a href="MADtv">MADtv</a>", Anton developed an extensive resume on television. He has made appearances on such television series as "<a href="Mr.%20Show%20with%20Bob%20and%20David">Mr. Show with Bob and David</a>", "<a href="Coach%20%28TV%20series%29">Coach</a>", "<a href="Boston%20Legal">Boston Legal</a>", "<a href="Entourage%20%28U.S.%20TV%20series%29">Entourage</a>", "<a href="Curb%20Your%20Enthusiasm">Curb Your Enthusiasm</a>", "<a href="The%20King%20of%20Queens">The King of Queens</a>", "<a href="Ally%20McBeal">Ally McBeal</a>", "<a href="Lizzie%20McGuire">Lizzie McGuire</a>", "<a href="Phil%20of%20the%20Future">Phil of the Future</a>", "<a href="Everybody%20Loves%20Raymond">Everybody Loves Raymond</a>", "<a href="Weekends%20at%20the%20D.L.">Weekends at the D.L.</a>", "<a href="2%20Broke%20Girls">2 Broke Girls</a>", and "<a href="Mad%20Men">Mad Men</a>". After leaving "MADtv" Craig was cast as Mr. Pettus in "Lizzie McGuire". After Season 1 ended Craig Anton left the show. He was eventually cast as Lloyd Diffy in "Phil of the Future".
Film projects.
Anton has appeared in such films as "Mail Bonding" (1995), "<a href="Deliver%20Us%20From%20Eva">Deliver Us From Eva</a>" (2003), "The Goldfish" (2003), "<a href="Run%20Ronnie%20Run">Run Ronnie Run</a>" (2002), "D-WAR" (2005), and "Careless" (2007). He also took part in the feature film is "<a href="The%20Mother%20of%20Invention">The Mother of Invention</a>" (2010).
Voice acting projects.
In 2004, Anton starred in the animated series "<a href="Tom%20Goes%20to%20the%20Mayor">Tom Goes to the Mayor</a>". He provided the voice (and body) of one of the three city council members.
Tomorrow Show.
Along with <a href="comedian">comedian</a>s <a href="Ron%20Lynch%20%28comedian%29">Ron Lynch</a> and <a href="Brendon%20Small">Brendon Small</a>, Craig hosted the "Tomorrow Show", a weekly <a href="Concert">live</a> <a href="Stand-up%20comedy">comedy show</a> at the <a href="Steve%20Allen%20Theater">Steve Allen Theater</a> in Los Angeles, California. Though Anton and Small are no longer actively involved with the show the two occasionally make surprise appearances including a yearly anniversary performance.
Personal life.
Anton married Lesley Gray in September 1994. They have twin daughters. They currently live in <a href="Savannah%2C%20Georgia">Savannah, Georgia</a>.
